title: Why aren’t academic cheating services (free or paid essay writers) deemed illegal and banned? - Quora

response.answer_text: They aren’t “illegal and banned” by government, but in effect they are still illegal (and “banned”) because using them constitutes a violation of a student’s (legal) contract with their school. In other words, if you use one of those organizations to write an essay for my class, I will charge you with plagiarism, the appeals committee will uphold it, and if you’re silly enough to waste money taking me to court, the judge will uphold it too. Centralized government action (“banning” in that sense) isn’t required in order for something to be illegal in a meaningful sense.

First off, plagiarism isn’t illegal. It’s dishonest, unethical, and against university rules, but it’s not a crime. (Note that plagiarism and copyright violation are different things. While they often occur together, you can have one without the other.) Assuming the essay service has the rights to papers they provide, it’s only when a user of such a service offers one of those essays as his or her own that a misdeed occurs. If someone is downloading and reading essays to learn about a topic, then nothing untoward is happening — to me it would be no different than reading an article in a journal.
